items.message:
Tides are expected to be higher than usual due to the forecasted weather conditions during coming tides.

Flooding is possible at the North Sea coast from Bridlington to Barmston between 11:30 PM tonight and 03:30 AM on 19/12/2022.

We are expecting further unsettled weather which may mean similar impacts for the next high tide tomorrow afternoon,19/12/2022, between 01:00 PM and 06:00 PM. 

Weather conditions are expected to produce large onshore waves, with particular areas at risk being frontages around South Pier and the Lifeboat Station in Bridlington. 

We will continue to monitor the forecast and re-issue this alert if necessary.

Please be careful along beaches, promenades, coastal footpaths and roads as large waves and sea spray could be dangerous.

This message will be updated by 10:00 AM on 19/12/2022, or as the situation changes.

"River levels are forecast to rise at the Whitewater Bridge river gauge as a result of predicted rainfall.  Consequently, flooding of roads and farmland is possible between 05:00 and 18:00 tomorrow, 19/12/22.  Areas most at risk are low-lying agricultural land and roads around Mansfield, the Sherwood Forest Caravan Park at Clipstone, Edwinstowe, Ollerton, Whitewater Lane at Whitewater Bridge and West Drayton.   
The forecast is unsettled for the next few days and we will continue to monitor the situation closely and update any alerts or warnings should the situation change.  
We expect river levels to remain high until 20:00 on 19/12/22.
We are closely monitoring the situation.  
Please plan driving routes to avoid low-lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded and avoid using low-lying footpaths near local watercourses.  
This message will be updated by 09:00 tomorrow morning, 19/12/22, or as the situation changes."

items.description: Upper Avon River Swift and Clay Coton Brook
items.message:
River levels are forecast to rise at the Lilbourne river gauge as a result of persistent rainfall.  Consequently, flooding of roads and farmland is expected later this evening and overnight.  Flooding is affecting low-lying land and roads adjacent to River Avon between Stanford and Rugby, River Swift between Cosford and Rugby and Clay Coton Brook between Yelvertoft and Lilbourne.   
  
We are closely monitoring the situation.  Our incident response staff are actively checking river levels and the weather forecast.  
Please avoid using low lying footpaths and bridges near local watercourses and plan driving routes to avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded.  

This message will be updated by 12:00 on 19/12/2022, or as the situation changes.

River levels are forecast to rise at the Eathorpe river gauge as a result of heavy rainfall.  Consequently, flooding of roads and farmland is expected from 03:30 tomorrow, 19/12/2022.  Flooding is affecting low-lying land and roads adjacent to the River Leam between Grandborough and Leamington including Kites Hardwick, Birdingbury, Marton, Eathorpe, Hunningham and Offchurch and the River Itchen between Southam and Marton including Long Itchington    

Further rainfall is forecast over the next 12 hours.  We expect river levels to begin rising at 19:00 on 18/12/2022.
We are closely monitoring the situation.  Our incident response staff are actively checking river levels and the weather forecast.  
Please avoid using low lying footpaths and bridges near local watercourses and plan driving routes to avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded.  

This message will be updated by 12:00 on 19/12/2022, or as the situation changes.

items.description: South East Somerset Rivers, Upper Reaches

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Yeo, River Cam, River Wriggle, Barwick Stream, West Coker Stream

items.message:
River levels have risen at the Chetnole and other river gauges as a result of persistent heavy rainfall.  Consequently, flooding of roads, paths and farmland is possible overnight, between 18/12/22 and 19/12/22.  We expect flooding to affect the Sparkford to Weston Bampfylde road and please avoid the ford at Deep Ford Lane, Chetnole.   
  We expect river levels to rise until the early hours of 19/12/22.
Our incident response staff have cleared weed screens. And we are closely monitoring the situation. 
Please plan your routes to avoid low lying roads and paths near rivers which may be flooded and refer to local authority website for local road closures.  
This message will be updated on 19/12/22, or as the situation changes.

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Asker, River Brit, River Bride, River Char, River Lim

items.message: Flooding is forecast to affect locations near the River Lim, River Char, River Winniford, Simene River, River Brit, River Asker, River Mangerton, River Bride, with low lying land expected to be most affected. River levels are rising at Beaminster, Burton Bradstock, Charmouth, Chideock, Jessops Avenue, Netherbury, Powerstock and Uplyme The Glebelands gauge. We will continue to monitor the forecast and re-issue this alert if necessary. Further rainfall is forecast over the next 6 hours. River levels can rise very quickly in response to rainfall. Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses and do not attempt to walk or drive through flood water. We urge all people to take care and not drive through flood water. This message will be updated by 10:00 am on 19/12/2022, or as the situation changes.

Persistent and at times heavy rain is forecast Sunday and Monday. There remains uncertainty in the forecast. Potentially half a month's rain (30-60mm) is possible. If as much rain falls as predicted, property flooding could be possible. From 01:00 19/12/2022 flooding could affect fields, rural roads, gardens and approach riverside properties through Buxted, near the White Hart pub and areas around Hempstead Mill on Hempstead Lane, Uckfield. Areas in Uckfield most at risk include The Roller Mill, Mill Lane, River Way, Bridge Cottage & Bell Walk. From 06:00 19/12/2022 flood water could approach properties at Isfield Mill and Isfield Bridge. Further rain predicted on Monday morning could cause the River Uck to rise higher again. The river might not begin to fall until Tuesday and with unsettled weather could remain higher than normal all week. As a precaution, we recommend flood protection products are to be installed in Buxted and Isfield, if you have them. We continue to monitor the levels and forecast. We will update this message by 11:00 19/12/2022.

Persistent and at times heavy rain is forecast Sunday and Monday. Potentially half a month's rain (30-60mm). Minor flood impacts are expected. If the higher amounts of rain occur, property flooding could be possible. From 03:00 19/12/2022 flooding could affect fields, rural roads, gardens and approach properties all along the Upper Ouse. Including near Dean's Water Mill, Sloop Lane and Fletching Mill Bridge and Sharpsbridge. From 07:00 19/12/2022 the Anchor Inn at Barcombe Mills will likely flood and Barcombe Mills Road is likely to be impassable. Property flooding at Barcombe Mills is possible if the higher amounts of rain occur. Further rain predicted Monday morning and Monday evening could cause the River Ouse to rise higher Monday afternoon and evening and remain higher than normal all week. As a precaution, we recommend flood protection products are to be installed in Barcombe, if you have them. We are operating our structures at Pimms Lock and Barcombe to help keep the river flowing freely and reduce flood risk. We will update this message by 11:00 19/12/2022.

Persistent and at times heavy rain is forecast on Sunday and Monday, potentially half a month's rain (30-60mm) could fall. Minor flood impacts are expected. If the higher amounts of rain occur, property flooding could be possible. From 22:00 on 18/12/2022, flooding could affect fields, rural roads, gardens and approach properties on Mill Lane, Hellingly, Grove Hill near Grovebridge Farm and Hammer Lane near Cowbeech. From 04:00 on 19/12/2022, flood impacts could affect properties on Station Road, Church Lane and Church Road. From 14:00 on 19/12/2022, flooding could also affect North Street, Willows Car Park, River Lane, The Old Clergy House and Deans Place Hotel, Alfriston. Further rain predicted on Monday morning and evening could cause the Cuckmere and Bull Rivers to rise higher again. River levels could remain higher than normal all week. Plan to avoid driving routes that are vulnerable to flooding, including Mill Lane and Church Road, Hellingly and North Street, Alfriston. We continue to monitor the levels and forecast. We will update this message by 11:00 on 19/12/2022.

items.eaAreaName: Devon, Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Tamar, River Strat, River Neet, River Ottery, River Kensey

items.message:
Flooding is expected overnight on Sunday 18th December. 
Heavy rain falling in the Upper Tamar area will continue throughout Sunday and Monday. This is causing the River Tamar to rise and the river is forecast to continue rising throughout the day.
Flooding is possible to low lying land and roads close to the river and around the Crowford Bridge and Tamarstone Bridge. River levels will start to peak in the early hours of Monday 19th December.
Flood waters may be deep and fast flowing in these areas. Residents are strongly urged to take action now. Remain safe and be aware of your local surroundings.
We will be closely monitoring the situation throughout the day and this message will be updated on Monday 19th December. Our staff are out in the area and will relay information and assist the emergency services and council. We are monitoring river levels and have staff in the area checking for and clearing blockages.

Persistent and at times heavy rain is forecast Sunday and Monday. Potentially half a month's rain (30-60mm). If as much rain falls as predicted, property flooding could be possible. From 22:00 18/12/2022 minor flooding could affect Station Road, Liss and Mill Lane and Old Mill Lane, Sheet. From 05:00 19/12/2022 minor flood impacts could affect Iping, Stedham and The Wharf, and nearby fields in Midhurst. From 11:00 19/12/2022 flood water could affect fields, rural roads and approach properties at Lodsbridge near Selham and Fittleworth. Properties on the Lod near Lickfold Bridge could also be affected. The river should initially begin to fall by 11:00 Monday 19/12/2022 in Liss. However, river levels could rise again Monday evening, with more rain forecast then. Which could make property flooding more likely. Between Midhurst and Fittleworth, river levels could remain higher than normal all week. Early actions to reduce potential impacts at Lodsbridge and Fittleworth are encouraged. We continue to monitor the levels and forecast. We will update this message by 11:00 19/12/2022.

Persistent and at times heavy rain is forecast this Sunday and Monday. Potentially half a month's rain (30-60mm) could fall. If as much rain falls as predicted, flooding could be possible. From 04:00 on 19/12/2022, minor flooding could affect gardens of Langney Green. Fields and parkland, including Shinewater Park, will also be affected. If 60mm of rain occurs, flood water could potentially approach properties of Langney Green. Further rain predicted on Monday morning could cause the Langney Haven to rise higher again. The river might not begin to fall until Tuesday (20/12/2022). With unsettled weather forecast for the next five days, river levels will remain higher than normal all week and probably into January 2023. As a precaution, we recommend flood protection products are to be installed at Langney Green, if you have them. We are operating our structures at Fence Bridge and Crumbles Gate to help keep the river flowing freely and reduce flood risk. We will update this message by 13:00 on 19/12/2022.

Persistent and at times heavy rain is forecast this Sunday and Monday. Potentially half a month's rain (30-60mm) could fall. Minor flood impacts are expected. If the higher amounts of rain occur, property flooding could be possible. From 23:00 on 18/12/2022, flooding could affect fields, rural roads, gardens and approach properties in Crowhurst. Flooding could potentially affect Crowhurst Recreation Ground, riverside properties on Forewood Lane and properties between the Plough public house and the junction of Sampsons Lane on Sandrock Hill. From Monday evening, water may also affect Bexhill Road Recreation Ground in Bulverhythe. Further rain predicted on Monday morning and evening could cause the Powdermill Stream and Combe Haven to rise higher again. With unsettled weather forecast for the next five days, the river could remain higher than normal all week. As a precaution, we recommend flood protection products are to be installed in Crowhurst, if you have them. We continue to monitor the levels and forecast. We will update this message by 11:00 on 19/12/2022.

Persistent and at times heavy rain is forecast this Sunday and Monday. Currently, only minimal or minor flood impacts are expected. However, with uncertainty in the weather forecast, if the location of the rainfall changes, property flooding could be possible. From 06:00 on 19/12/2022, minor flooding could affect fields, rural roads and gardens along the length of the River Arun, including at Tanbridge Park, Blackbridge Court and Arunside in Horsham, and isolated riverside properties between Broadbridge Heath and Pallingham Quay. River levels should begin to fall from 13:00 on Monday 19/12/2022. However, further rain predicted on Monday into the evening could cause the River Arun to rise higher again. With unsettled weather forecast for the next five days, the river could remain higher than normal all week. As a precaution, we recommend flood protection products are to be installed in Wanford, if you have them. Our automatic sluice at Provender Mill is operating to help reduce the risk of flooding through Horsham. We will update this message by 13:00 on 19/12/2022.

Persistent and at times heavy rain is forecast this Sunday and Monday. Potentially half a month's rain (30-60mm) could fall. There remains uncertainty about exactly where the heaviest rain will fall, but if as much rain falls as predicted, flooding could be possible. From 06:00 on 19/12/2022, minor flooding could affect fields, rural roads, gardens along the length of the River Lox and approach properties near Brewhurst Mill on Brewhurst Lane and the Onslow Arms, Loxwood. Minor flooding could also affect isolated riverside properties at Loxley Bridge, Dunsfold and on Petworth Road, Chiddingfold. River levels may temporarily peak around 15:00 on Monday 19/12/2022. However, further rain predicted during Monday into the evening could cause the River Lox to rise higher again. With unsettled weather forecast for the next five days, the river could remain higher than normal all week. Please continue to operate private water control structures at Brewhurst to reduce the risk of flooding. We continue to monitor the levels and forecast. We will update this message by 13:00 on 19/12/2022.

Persistent and at times heavy rain is forecast Sunday and Monday. Potentially half a month's rain (30-60mm). If as much rain falls as predicted, flooding could be possible. From 21:00 18/12/2022 minor flooding could affect Marshall Close, Lake Lane and Barnham Road, Barnham. From 14:00 19/12/2022 flood water could affect fields near Shripney Lane and the A259. If 60mm of rain falls, flood water could affect parts of the car park at Tesco’s on Shripney Road and Riverside Caravan Centre and Rowan Park Caravan Park. The river should initially begin to fall by 04:00 Monday 19/12/2022 in Barnham and 20:00 19/12/2022 in Bersted. However, river levels could rise again Monday evening. The Aldingbourne Rife will probably not peak as high as November, initially. But will remain higher than normal into January. As a precaution, we recommend flood protection products are to be installed in Barnham, if you have them. We are clearing grilles through Barnham, including at the Trading Post and our pumps at Felpham are running to reduce flood risk. We will update this message by 11:00 19/12/2022.

items.description: Rivers Clyst and Culm and their tributaries
items.eaAreaName: Devon, Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly
items.message:
Flooding is possible on Sunday evening and overnight into Monday morning.
Throughout Sunday 18 December 2022 heavy rainfall has been falling in the Rivers Clyst and Culm area and is forecast to continue for the next couple of days causing rivers to rise.
Flooding to low lying land and roads is expected. 
We expect the rivers to remain high throughout the early part of this week and will remain sensitive to further rainfall.  We may issue Flood Warnings as necessary.
Take care near the areas of concern and monitor your local weather conditions. We are constantly monitoring river levels and will have staff in the area checking for and clearing blockages. This message will be updated on the afternoon of Monday 19 December 2022 or earlier if the situation changes.

River levels have risen at the Chiselborough and other river gauges as a result of persistent heavy rainfall.  Consequently, flooding of roads, paths and farmland is possible overnight, between 18/12/22 and 19/12/22.  We expect flooding to affect the roads at Ashford Mill, Isle Brewers, Fivehead, the Norton sub Hambdon to Stratton road, the A356 and the B3165 at Chiselborough and the B3168 at Ilford Bridges. The lower River Parrett is forecast to be bankfull and overtopping could occur.   
  We expect river levels to rise until the early hours of 19/12/22.
Our incident response staff have cleared weed screens. And we are closely monitoring the situation. 
Please plan your routes to avoid low lying roads and paths near rivers which may be flooded and refer to local authority website for local road closures.  
This message will be updated on 19/12/22, or as the situation changes.

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Plym, Tory Brook, Long Brook

items.message:
Flooding is possible overnight on Sunday 18th December.  

Over the last 12 hours we have seen heavy rainfall and the River Plym is now rising.  Further heavy rain is forecast tonight and on Monday 19th December. 

Expected levels suggest that there will be flooding to low lying land and roads close to the river in the early hours of Monday morning. 

We expect the river to remain high throughout Monday. Take care near the areas of concern and monitor your local weather conditions.  We are monitoring river levels and have staff in the area checking for and clearing blockages. This message will be updated on Monday afternoon or earlier if the situation changes.

items.eaAreaName: Devon, Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly
items.message:
Flooding is possible overnight on Sunday 18th December.  Over the last 12 hours we have seen heavy rainfall and the River Yealm is now rising.  Further rain is forecast through Monday 19th December morning. 
Expected levels suggest that there will be flooding to low lying land and roads close to the river from around 10pm on Sunday 18th December. We expect the river to remain high throughout Monday.  Take care near the areas of concern and monitor your local weather conditions.  
We are monitoring river levels and have staff in the area checking for and clearing blockages. This message will be updated on Monday or earlier if the situation changes.

Persistent and at times heavy rain is forecast this Sunday and Monday. Currently, only minimal or minor flood impacts are expected. However, with uncertainty in the weather forecast, if the location of the rainfall changes, property flooding could be possible. From 06:00 on 19/12/2022, minor flooding could affect fields, rural roads and gardens along the length of the River Adur. If more rain than is expected falls, flooding could affect property at Slaughter Bridge on the Coolham Road, as well as isolated farm buildings, fields and rural roads between Coolham and Henfield, and gardens of Church Close, Shipley. River levels should initially begin to fall from 13:00 on Monday 19/12/2022. However, further rain predicted on Monday could cause the River Adur to rise again. With unsettled weather forecast for the next five days, the river could remain higher than normal all week. Plan to avoid driving through routes vulnerable to flooding, including the Coolham Road at Slaughter Bridge. We continue to monitor the levels and forecast. We will update this message by 13:00 on 19/12/2022.

items.eaAreaName: Devon, Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly
items.message:
Flooding is possible this evening Sunday 18th December and into the early hours of Monday 19th December morning.  

Heavy rain falling in the area will continue throughout Sunday and Monday. This is causing the River Lynher to rise and rivers in the area are forecast to continue rising over the rest of the day. The peak is expected to be in the early hours of Monday 19th December. 

Flooding is possible from Sunday night. Further heavy rain is forecast through Monday morning, expected levels suggest that there will be flooding to low lying land and roads close to the river, peaking between 9pm and midnight Sunday evening.  We expect the river to remain high throughout Monday.  Take care near the areas of concern and monitor your local weather conditions. This message will be updated on Monday evening or earlier if the situation changes

items.description: River Brit at Newtown, and Southgate Old Mill, Beaminster
items.message:
River levels are high and forecast to rise further on the River Brit due to rainfall.
Flooding is forecast to affect locations near the River Brit, with low lying land expected to be most affected, particularly around properties in Southgate and Newtown in Beaminster.
River levels are expected to remain high until 19/12/2022.
Further rainfall is forecast overnight.
We will continue to monitor levels closely.
Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses and do not attempt to walk or drive through flood water.
This message will be updated by 10:00 AM on 19/12/2022, or as the situation changes.

items.eaAreaName: Devon, Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly
items.message:
Flooding is expected overnight on Sunday 18th December.  

Heavy rain falling in the St Austell area will continue throughout Sunday and Monday. This is causing the Mevagissey Stream to rise and rivers in the area are forecast to continue rising over the rest of the day. The peak is expected to be in the early hours of Monday 19th December.

Flooding is possible from Sunday night. Further heavy rain is forecast through Monday morning, expected levels suggest that there will be flooding to low lying land and roads close to the river, peaking between 9pm and midnight Sunday evening. The main areas of concern in Mevagissey are around the Willow Carpark. We expect the river to remain high throughout Monday. 

Take care near the areas of concern and monitor your local weather conditions. This message will be updated on Monday evening or earlier if the situation changes.

items.eaAreaName: Devon, Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly
items.message:

Over the last 12 hours we have seen heavy rainfall and the River Seaton is now rising. Further rain is forecast through the morning of Monday 19th December.

Expected levels suggest that there will be flooding to low lying land and roads close to the river from this evening, Sunday 18th December. We expect the river to remain high throughout Monday. Take care near the areas of concern and monitor your local weather conditions.   

We are monitoring river levels and have staff in the area checking for and clearing blockages. This message will be updated on Monday or earlier if the situation changes.

floodArea.riverOrSea: Polegate Brook Street Stream, Wannock Mill Stream

items.message: Persistent and at times heavy rain is forecast this Sunday and Monday. Potentially half a month's rain (30-60mm) could fall. If as much rain falls as predicted, flooding could be possible. From 23:00 on 18/12/2022, minor flooding could affect gardens of Brook Street and Gosford Way and the Gosford Way allotments. Flooding could also affect riverside properties at Millstream Gardens, The Millrace, Clement Lane, Brightling Road and Manor Way. River levels might begin to fall during a period of drier weather from 02:00 on Monday 19/12/2022. However, further rain predicted around 07:00 on Monday morning could cause the Wannock Mill Stream to rise again. With unsettled weather throughout the next five-day forecast, small water level rises are possible all week. If you see a blockage affecting the flow in the river, please call our incident hotline on 0800 80 70 60. We routinely clear debris from our grilles on Gosford Way to help keep the river flowing freely and reduce flood risk. We will update this message by 11:00 on 19/12/2022.

items.eaAreaName: Devon, Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Hayle, Perrancoombe Stream, Bolingey Stream, River Cober, Portreath Stream

items.message:
Flooding is possible overnight on Sunday 18th December. 

Over the last 12 hours we have seen heavy rainfall and the rivers in West Cornwall are now rising. Further heavy rain is forecast through the night and throughout Monday, expected levels suggest that there will be flooding to low lying land and roads close to the rivers in the early hours of Monday 19th December. 

We expect the rivers to remain high throughout Monday. Take care near the areas of concern and monitor your local weather conditions. We are monitoring river levels and have staff in the area checking for and clearing blockages. 

This message will be updated on Monday afternoon or earlier if the situation changes.

Persistent and at times heavy rain is forecast Sunday and Monday. Potentially half a month's rain (30-60mm). If as much rain falls as predicted, flooding could be possible. From 19:00 18/12/2022 flooding could affect fields, Brook Meadows, rural roads, gardens and approach properties on North Street, River Street and at the Wren Centre, Westbourne. Also near Lumley Mill and Victoria Terrace, Emsworth. The river should initially begin to fall by 04:00 Monday 19/12/2022. However, river levels could rise again Monday evening if, as is currently forecast, more rain occurs then. There is the possibility of small amounts of rain most days next week. The River Ems will remain higher than normal throughout January. As a precaution, we recommend flood protection products are to be installed in Westbourne and Emsworth, if you have them. Flooding could occur in a short space of time, so please be prepared. We are operating our structure at Constant Springs and clearing grilles to help keep the river flowing freely and reduce flood risk. We will update this message by 11:00 19/12/2022.
